# qr-decode-encode

[![GitHub Workflow Status](https://img.shields.io/github/workflow/status/mattlubner/qr-decode-encode/Semantic%20Release)](https://github.com/mattlubner/qr-decode-encode/actions?query=workflow%3A%22Semantic+Release%22) [![npm](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/qr-decode-encode)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/qr-decode-encode)

Simple shell commands for decoding / encoding QR codes.

Useful for extracting the secret from a 2FA (two factor auth) QR code, so it can be entered into your favorite password manager (such as 1Password).

## Quick Start

#### Install

```sh
yarn global add qr-decode-encode
```

<details>
  <summary><i>Alternate install methods</i></summary>
  
  >  ```sh
  >  git clone https://github.com/mattlubner/qr-decode-encode.git
  >  cd qr-decode-encode
  >  yarn install
  >  yarn link
  >  ```
</details>

#### Decode a QR Code into a string

```sh
> qr-decode-encode decode "data:image/png;base64,"
i am a qr code
```

#### Encode a string as a QR Code

```sh
> qr-decode-encode encode "i am a qr code"
data:image/png;base64,
```
